Text:
You mean my old vinyl has value! I have this album, plus about 100 others from the mid-1970s that were selected from Martin Bookspan's Basic Repertoire. Most were only played once.

I did look this one up. I only found one for sale in the UK for $64.

I have the hardware to rip vinyl (restored Dual 1229, Shure V 15 Type IV, Pro-Ject Tube Box II), but I haven't figured out the software.

My cover is in better condition than the included scan. So I scanned mine to make them available to others.

Full 300 dpi size:
Front:  http://imageshack.us/a/img850/5872/bu13.jpg
Back:  http://imageshack.us/a/img541/5246/9dhg.jpg

800x800 for embedded art:  http://imageshack.us/a/img195/4563/arho.jpg

I see that by selecting Optimize Imageshack increased the compression and degraded the image quality. Here is the 800x800 again without optimization:

http://imageshack.us/a/img856/4514/cl20.jpg

I see that by selected Optimize ImageShack increased the compression and reduced the image quality. Here it is again without the optimization.

http://imageshack.us/a/img856/4514/cl20.jpg

I'm sure the high price I saw on line for this item was only valid for a genuine  first-press"blue black" LP London from 1958 or so. Subsequent pressings, especially as late at the 1970s, would not have that value.
